intro: Phanera junghuhniana, commonly known as the Junghuhnia or Malayan phanera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia, and is typically found in tropical rainforests. The plant is a shrub or small tree, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
